comments:
I've installed last integration build I20051116-1332 and I cannot open my
workspace I worked with previous I-Build.

Would it be possible to have a patch or a workaround as this workspace contains
really important things for me and I really do not want to lose them (historic
of changes on files for example...), TIA

Here are exceptions I got in .log file:

I saw a similar problem with one of my workspaces using I20051115-0800.  I 
moved back to last weeks I-Build and the workspace came back.  But now I moved 
back up to I20051116-1332 and I cannot seem to reproduce.  I think this is  
core.resources problem.

I also moved back to last week I-Build and my workspace came back. However, I
still get these exceptions when I tried again to switch on I20051116-1332 after...

Note that I can open a brand new workspace or a real simple old one (just one
project Test in it with one class Test...).
But I get these exceptions with all my other workspaces (at least all
o.e.jdt.core* projects loaded in it).

I think you will get the failure when a workspace contains a project that is
outside the default location... I will work on a fix/patch.

Is there any possible workaround waiting for this patch (except than remove
external project of course...)?
I suggest staying on the previous integration build until I have a patch.
*** Bug 116874 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I have released the fix to HEAD.  A patch that works on any I-build from this
week is available here:

http://eclipse.org/eclipse/platform-core/downloads.html#patches

Don't forget to restart with -clean after dropping the patch in your plugins
directory.  Thanks to our new qualified version numbers it is not necessary to
delete the old jar first.  I will also send a note to platform-releng-dev.

And, sorry for the headaches this probably caused.  I renamed the "Assert" class
in core.resources to prevent a collision with the new Assert in runtime, and
when I released this big batch of changes I accidentally released some work in
progress code that was not complete.
